subject: Law
title: Arbitration Clauses and Access to Courts
description: A 60-second lesson on Arbitration Clauses and Access to Courts.

hook.text: You want to sue a company, but the contract says all disputes go to arbitration. You never noticed that clause.

buildup.text: Arbitration clauses require disputes to be resolved by a private arbitrator instead of a court.

discovery.text: Companies favor arbitration: it's faster, private, and often less expensive than litigation.

twist.text: Critics say forced arbitration strips consumers and employees of their right to a jury trial and class actions.

climax.text: The Supreme Court has broadly upheld arbitration clauses, even in consumer and employment contracts.
